DELETE /accounts/{account_id}/gateway/ce.description: Delete a gateway-managed Zero Trust certificate. You must deactivate the certificate from the edge (inactive) before deleting it.

schema.description: Identify the certificate with a UUID.

success.description: Indicate whether the API call was successful.

binding_status.description: Indicate the read-only deployment status of the certificate on Cloudflare's edge. Gateway TLS interception can use certificates in the 'available' (previously called 'active') state.

fingerprint.description: Provide the SHA256 fingerprint of the certificate (read-only).

id.description: Identify the certificate with a UUID.

in_use.description: Indicate whether Gateway TLS interception uses this certificate (read-only). You cannot set this value directly. To configure interception, use the Gateway configuration setting named `certificate` (read-only).

issuer_org.description: Indicate the organization that issued the certificate (read-only).

issuer_raw.description: Provide the entire issuer field of the certificate (read-only).

type.description: Indicate the read-only certificate type, BYO-PKI (custom) or Gateway-managed.

success.description: Indicate whether the API call was successful.

fingerprint.description: Provide the SHA256 fingerprint of the certificate (read-only).

id.description: Identify the certificate with a UUID.

in_use.description: Indicate whether Gateway TLS interception uses this certificate (read-only). You cannot set this value directly. To configure interception, use the Gateway configuration setting named `certificate` (read-only).

issuer_org.description: Indicate the organization that issued the certificate (read-only).

issuer_raw.description: Provide the entire issuer field of the certificate (read-only).

type.description: Indicate the read-only certificate type, BYO-PKI (custom) or Gateway-managed.

success.description: Indicate whether the API call was successful.

4XX.description: Deletes Zero Trust certificate response failure.

GET /accounts/{account_id}/gateway/certi.description: List all Zero Trust certificates for an account.

success.description: Indicate whether the API call was successful.

count.description: Indicate the total number of results for the requested service.

page.description: Indicate the current page within a paginated list of results.

per_page.description: Indicate the number of results per page.

total_count.description: Indicate the total results available without any search parameters.

POST /accounts/{account_id}/gateway/cert.description: Create a new Zero Trust certificate.

validity_period_days.description: Sets the certificate validity period in days (range: 1-10,950 days / ~30 years). Defaults to 1,825 days (5 years). **Important**: This field is only settable during the certificate creation.  Certificates becomes immutable after creation - use the `/activate` and `/deactivate` endpoints to manage certificate lifecycle.

success.description: Indicate whether the API call was successful.

binding_status.description: Indicate the read-only deployment status of the certificate on Cloudflare's edge. Gateway TLS interception can use certificates in the 'available' (previously called 'active') state.

type.description: Indicate the read-only certificate type, BYO-PKI (custom) or Gateway-managed.
